Despite its age and the now aging graphical engine, the game is still extremely pleasing. The difficulty level is itself pretty gradual, so even beginner (what Ii was when I bought it) can make it.
It is all about teamwork, if (what alas remains most of the time a matter of chance) manage to get with a good team, you'll really enjoy it. Do ot even consider the solo mode when you start, it almost digusted me from an indeed funny game.
The game itself is a no brainer, but still requires good skills. The challenge itself is part of fun, and no, expected in the beginner mode, victory is not a guarantee, what makes it rewarding.
The only shortcoming is, I think, the perk system (the more you make kills in your class the more efficient you become in that class), which basically means one has to go the upper difficulty levels to find back the level it enjoyed at the beginning of the game.
In brief, it is a game where the players understand they're here to have fun, and basically you do have fun.

Here's the best way to explain this game: Arcade Left 4 Dead. It can be super fun when there's tons of Zeds coming at you. The only thing I don't like about Killing Floor is the amount of "grinding" you have to do to level up a class. Somewhat related: it's really hard to be anything less than fodder in online games as a low level player. I'd highly advise grinding out some levels in your preferred class in Solo mode before venturing out online if you don't want to get laughed at.
I recomend this game over all my shooters!

This is a very fun game! I have not played it for to long but it is still really fun and addicting, It is definitely worth it and it is on sale a lot so get it when it is on sale! If you love zombies you need to get this game, it's just that simple.

If you love thrilling survival horror then this game is definitely a must have!. It has plenty of perks (classes), skills and guns to choose from to take down the speciments and the end boss (The Patriarch).

This is one of two games that I have been stuck on infinitely. Haven't stopped playing it since the day I bought it. There is plenty of content and re-playability, and servers for 64 people and all kinds of great community mods like adding Dead Space mode and Aliens and the list goes on.

I would recommend this as the zombie game of choice. It's not openworld, but I'd rather it be this way as it's much more thrilling and heart-pounding, you'll have legions of zombies after you followed by giants with meat-grinders for hands... it's just a must-own game.
awsome

Cool game, worth the full price very much.
As a sidenote, you should wait until it gets discounted, the whole pack with all the DLCs. That way you can get every new character, every weapon and all for dirt cheap.

It's fun both alone and friends, even if you pump hundreds of hours into it.
Grinding is not for everyone, but you can simply load up a custom map and grind up there blazing fast.

So yeah, it's a good game.
10/10.

A great and fun Co-op survival game. Up to 6 players can play, or play it solo. There's 6 different perks that deal with sharpshooting, medics, demolitions, commandos (Assault rifles), Berserker (Melee weapons) and Firebug (incendiary weapons) All go up to level 6 and start at level 0. Let the Co-op survival horror begin!

I apologize for my bias review. I've never been a big fan of these FPS survival types. I dont really care for this game myself, however, it is definitely put together well. I didnt experience any bugs while i was playing. there are a lot of options for improving your character as you blast your way though the waves of gingerbread men, reindeers and santas. The graphics are really good. I was visually impressed. If you like these style of games, then you will probably like this one.

This is a great zombie survival game! The classes in the game allows for more varried gameplay every game. There is a lot of different maps to play on and all together a lot of fun! The game is perfect both for single and multiplayer games. The money system is also quite nice and balanced and dosen´t allow for too quick advancement through the weapons. 

P.S The DLCs for this game is mostly just for apperance and is a bit boring. Most of them is just a reskin of weapons you already have or just a new player model. I recomend the comunity weapons packs tho they are realy cool! (because you get new weps)

This game is certainly way better than you think.

The easy days when you just had to pick up a gun and shoot your way through zombies is over. Killing Floor is serious business. Well, seriously fun business.
This a wave survival FPS game. You begin with small guns, kill Zeds and heal teammates to make money, survive the first easy rounds, go buy better guns, armor and ammo for the next wave, and repeat, against more and tougher Zeds, until the final wave against the Patriarch. You have perks, like specialties, which give you bonuses as you level them up.

You don't play this game for the graphics, but for the gameplay. All players can find their specialty, for melee, long-range, support, demolition... Cooperation is greatly enhanced (money or gun drop, health, communication) and mandatory on harder difficulties. Difficulty and number of players both impact Zeds' toughness.
And i don't even speak about the number of community created maps and mods, or the regular events changing the skins and the achievements, all freely available.

It is a great zombie game... With some frightening coming out of nowhere little crawlers, the dangerous fleshpound, the little clot, gorefasts speeding up to slash you, it's crazy. You have to go through a number of waves through these specimens. (With more and more per wave.) And in between Waves you can run to a Trader where you can buy better/more weapons. Better get the good guns because once you finish what you think is the last round (4/4 7/7 10/10 etc.) there is one more round~With the incredibly powerful patriarch. He has guns, rockets, and a dangerous tenticle that attacks close targets. Don't, worry about coming to find him, HE will come looking for YOU.
